00010 // helper class which maintains our process table
00011 class joblist
00012 {
00013   private:
00014     // the information we keep for all jobs.  We should, 
00015     // actually, be able to all info from the jobid alone...
00016     typedef struct 
00017     {
00018       int         pid;
00019       std::string jobid;
00020       std::string command;
00021       saga::job::job   job;
00022     } entry_t;
00023 
00024     typedef std::list <entry_t>           list_t;
00025     typedef std::list <entry_t>::iterator list_it_t;
00026 
00027     list_t list_;
00028     int    last_pid_;
00029 
00030 
00031   public:
00032     joblist (void);
00033    ~joblist (void) { };
00034 
00035     // a couple of methods to manipulate the process table
00036     int         add (std::string jobid, 
00037                      std::string command, 
00038                      saga::job::job   job);
00039     void        del (std::string jobid);
00040     void        del (int         pid);
00041

00045
